65 2021-02-01 palpitations, heart rate increased Vaccinated at 1:20 PM on 1/26/2021. Approximately 15 min later I was in the waiting area, the nurse ... Read more
Close
Vaccinated at 1:20 PM on 1/26/2021. Approximately 15 min later I was in the waiting area, the nurse had been pre-notified to watch me for allergic reaction . In 15 minutes my symptoms were fast heart rate, lips burning, dark red facial flushing, ears flushing, and anterior neck flush, body tremors, a rapid response team notified to evaluate me. I was administered a 25 mg Benadryl tablet per mouth. I felt stabilized and chose to go to the ER within the building for further evaluation. Remaining stabilized, had a 4 hour wait until I was seen by emergency staff. My treatment was Solumedrol IV, Pepcid IV and Benadryl 25 mg po. I was placed on a heart monitor and a pulse oximeter to check my oxygen levels the entire time I was in the ER. 4 hours prior to being seen by the ER doctors I had a CBC, a BMP blood work, and an EKG. After medications were administered I was observed approximately 1.5-2 hours. I was discharged with a 5 day medicine regimen to follow. Prednisone 40 mg per day; Pepcid 40 mg per day; Benadryl 25 mg every 6 hours. On 1/27 I chose to take the Benadryl 25 mg only because I had received the Pepcid and Prednisone the previous night late. On the 28th I took the medicine as prescribed but only took Benadryl every 12 hours. I felt Benadryl 4 times a day would not be handled well with my body. On 1/30 I was able to take the Pepcid and Prednisone but had to discontinue the Benadryl due to waking up with a spinning sensation upon opening eyes and a loss of equilibrium upon walking. I completed my medicine regimen on 2/1. Today 2/2 I woke up with symptoms of watery eyes, flushed face, mild facial itching, after drinking one cup of full caffeine coffee developed an increased heart rate and nervousness, was medicated with Benadryl 25 mg po at 10:00 AM along with my blood pressure medicine and potassium. Also at that time my blood pressure was 150/80. Three hours later my blood pressure had come down to 130s/60s but felt extreme weakness and felt the need to lay down and rest with legs elevated. I continue with my day with increased heart rate with activity, so I have remained inactive for the rest of the day. Also on 6:00 AM on 1/27 I was awakened with a heart rate In the 160s, I called 911, paramedics came 5 minutes later. On arrival my heart rate had instantly went down to the 112-120 range. The paramedics explained they have been treating COVID patients and have seen this a lot, we discussed going to the hospital but I felt I was stabilized and didn't need further treatment. Also upon discharge from ER visit they had me get 2 epi-pens and I now have 2 epi-pens available at home.

Patient had the first Moderna Covid vaccine on Thursday 1/21/2021. She had a bit of sore arm on that day and the day after. On Saturday 1/23/2021, she had a fever of 100.5 F (11AM), nausea, light headache and chills. The temperature went down after she took ibuprofen. Patient's husband enrolled her to V-Safe to report all the adverse effects she experienced. On Sunday 1/24/2021, her temperature was 98.3F. She still had nausea and no appetite. She and her husband watched a football game in their bedroom upstairs. Husband noticed that his wife was pacing around the room many times. At 7Pm, Husband went downstairs for dinner but she refused to come down to eat. He went upstairs around 8pm, TV was still on. He turned off TV and went down stairs again thinking his wife felt as sleep while watching TV. He went back upstairs for bed around 10:30 PM. Husband said his wife had a deviated septum so she would snore very loudly when asleep. He didn?t hear her snoring so he went to check on her and found her not responsive. Husband called emergency services. Paramedic came at 10:45 and said patient was passed. Husband sent many texts to V-safe after that to report the incident. No response was received from V-safe. Patient?s doctor told her husband that she died due to cardiac arrest.

65 2021-03-03 blood pressure increased Patient received her COVID-19 Moderna vaccine this afternoon. She then started "feeling strange" a ... Read more
Close
Patient received her COVID-19 Moderna vaccine this afternoon. She then started "feeling strange" a few minutes later, requesting fresh air. She was monitored outside for 30 minutes. Her O2sat remained >96%ile the entire time. Her HR remained in 60s-70s. Her initial blood pressure was elevated at 210s/140s and improved to 140s/110s with calming relaxation techniques. She did have brief jerking episodes of her lower extremities intermittently. They were suppressible. She remained conscious the entire time and maintained good eye contact. At minute ~20 post-vaccination, she endorsed not remembering why she was there, requesting to stand up. She stood up with support and then sat back down. Repeat BP was elevated to SBP 200s. Decision was made to continue observation in Urgent Care as her blood pressure was still elevated and she still appeared anxious. She was speaking in full sentences and was drinking water without assistance. She was placed into wheelchair and brought to Urgent Care. However, during UC triage, she reportedly informed nursing that she didn't want to be in the enclosed observation room in UC, that she wanted to go home. Her partner wheeled her outside to the patio. When nursing went to go find her, the patient had eloped.

65 2021-03-06 chest discomfort Client was in post vaccine waiting area and after 15 minutes post vaccine she reported dizziness and... Read more
Close
Client was in post vaccine waiting area and after 15 minutes post vaccine she reported dizziness and an "uncomfortable feeling" across her chest (does not describe in any more specific terms). VS: HR 73, RR 20, BP 120/80, O2 sat 96%. Client denies any other symptoms and no other changes are noted. Medical information/history was taken, during this time the clients symptoms began to improve. 2:50pm VS: HR 71, RR 20, BP 120/70, O2 sat 97%; client reported symptoms have completely resolved. Assisted client to stand and walk in observation area, gait is steady and client denies any dizziness or return of the "uncomfortable feeling" across her chest. 3:15pm client was assisted to her family vehicle (driven by her daughter) and with the assistance of the translator information was given for the client to seek medical attention if the symptoms return or worsen.

Too ill to function--I had Covid-19 in November, and my response was worse than my worse day of the two week illness. I was literally green in the face, faint-ish and quite nauseous. I am a healthy person and am quite active. I was in bed unable to do anything for about 12 hours.
65 2021-03-08 heart rate increased I received the Moderna COVID-19 first shot vaccination at 11:00am on Thursday, 3/4/21. The next ... Read more
Close
I received the Moderna COVID-19 first shot vaccination at 11:00am on Thursday, 3/4/21. The next day, Friday, 3/5/21, at about 10:00am, I experienced chills and muscle fatigue that lasted until bedtime about 11:00pm. Life returned to normal until yesterday, 3/8/21, when, beginning around 11:00pm and lasting until 11:00pm bedtime, I experience body chills similar to 3/5/21. Today, Tuesday, 3/9/21, when I awoke at 6:00pm, my heart rate was noticeably elevated but stabilized within 15 minutes. And about 10:55am, as I was focusing on work (reviewing/editing an electronic document), I had an unusual blurry vision and mentally spacious experience that lasted for less than 2 minutes but required me to halt work and collect my thoughts. These experiences are completely new to me.

Close
My arm was throbbing with pain down into my hands. I could hardly lift my arm and could not sleep the first night. I had fever of 100.3, headache, rapid heart beat and joint pain throughout the night. Off and on, I iced my arm for hours. I finally took extra strength tylenol 23 hrs after the injection. It helped but my fever persisted until Tuesday, March 9th along with headache and arm pain. On the evening of March 9, i developed a huge red, warm rash all over my upper arm below the injection site. It is more than half way around my arm and about 3-4 inches long. I rubbed benedryl on it and took a Benedryl pill. It still appears on my arm and is warm and tender on the morning of March 11th.

65 2021-03-09 heart rate increased Vaccine #1 - Received first dose of Moderna 1/14/2021 -- Ten-15 minutes after injection began to ha... Read more
Close
Vaccine #1 - Received first dose of Moderna 1/14/2021 -- Ten-15 minutes after injection began to have lips and mouth tingling, wheezing, increase heart rate. Told people at clinic. They said to sit for another 15 minutes and come and get them if it got worse. I went back after ~ 30 minutes total and a couple of medical assistants took my blood pressure. It was 178/158 (normally I run 128/ 68). They asked me to take my inhaler (Advair was all that I had so I took a dose). In addition they gave me one Benadryl tablet (25 mg). 1 hour 20 minutes later my heart rate was 157/124 they gave me another Benadryl to take on my way home if I needed it. *** When I got to my home 30-40 minutes away. I called my internist. I spoke with her nurse and they called back and told me to take my second dose of 25 mg Benadryl. She told me to take 25 to 50 mg of Benadryl one hour before getting my second dose of Moderna vaccine. I had significant swelling on the injection site 3-4 inches in diameters that went down after 5-6/days. Vaccine # 2 - I received my second dose of Moderna 2/19/2021. I took 25mg Benadryl ~ 30 minutes before vaccine and took the additional 25 mg when I returned home. I was extremely cold and could not get warm for 48 hours I took Tylenol. There was no fever. I had wheezing. Swelling day #1 was 1-2 inches Days 2-5 swelling was 4-5.5 inches in diameter. Five to seven days later the swelling and pain resolved.

65 2021-03-13 chest discomfort Patient received first dose of Moderna vaccine in the left deltoid at 1200. Within one minute post ... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna vaccine in the left deltoid at 1200. Within one minute post vaccine administration, patient stated, "I am dizzy and don't feel good." RN called vaccine team lead and clinical operation lead to come assist the patient on a wheelchair and brought her to the observation area to continue monitoring. At 1205 patients BP: 112/78, pulse: 68, O2: 100%, she was given some water to drink and she stated, "I am having a stabbing feeling along my chest". At 1210: EMS was called. At 1213: patient had flushed skin, tongue swelling, and burning sensation was occurring, epi pen was administered on left mid thigh. At 1219: EMS arrived. At 1220: patients vitals: BP: 142/64, pulse: 79, and O2: 100% and stated, "I can swallow now". At 1230: EMS left with patient in stable condition.

Close
After chills low grade fever March 8th first night of vaccine, the second day March 9th severe headache neck stiffness/pain, dark urine on waking in am. Heart bounding with some skipped beats. At 12:30 wave of nausea, sat on bathroom floor then awakened outside of bathroom on floor. Got to couch and checked my oxygen saturation with husbands pulse oximeter with no reading showing. My fingers were yellowish and nailbeds pale slightly bluish. I put my husbands oxygen on nasal cannula at 2liters and oxygen saturation came up to 96% and I felt better. Left oxygen on till evening. Drank as much water as I could. March 10th still dehydrated heart rate 100 with some skipped beats and still bounding oxygen saturation 94% room air. Still some nausea. Urine less dark but cloudy. March 11th. Still stiff neck. New left face pain and yellow bruising near left jaw below temple with 2 small blood filled pimple like spots. Better now.

About 13 hours after receiving the vaccine I experienced excruciating body aches both muscular and skeletal throughout my body. I have never been in such pain before. I took 2 ibuprofen immediately upon being awakened by the pain. The episode last 2 hours. I also became quite nauseous during the latter part of the 2 hours. I experienced a brief but intense headache during the episode. After that I had intermittent intense pain at sites on my body where I have had injuries in the past year (right shoulder, right foot/ankle, and left elbow tendon. Also, throughout the night I had multiple occurrences of what I deemed extra heart beats. I had extreme dry mouth and periods of feeling hot and cold. FYI, after first shot I had what has been described as "covid arm."

65 2021-03-17 loss of consciousness Moderna Fact Sheet reviewed with the client along with V-Safe Information. COVID-19 screening review... Read more
Close
Moderna Fact Sheet reviewed with the client along with V-Safe Information. COVID-19 screening reviewed. Per Report, patient had completed observation after vaccination without problems. She was a passenger in her husband's vehicle- they left the county fairgrounds (Vaccination Site) . Per report, her husband looked over and the client was passes out- he proceeded a measurement of feet down the street and pulled back into the fairground entrance. He immediately requested the staff to call the squad. The patient came around prior to the squad arrival. the staff estimated that the client was potentially " out" for a matter of 3 mins. between leaving observation and returning to the grounds. Our Staff report the client was "out" for approximately 1 min while waiting for the squad to arrive. Client was unconscious per report at time of calling the squad. However prior to the squad arrival the client awoke. Any clinical assessment is unavailable after that. The client and her husband refused treatment from the EMS responders and left the site at will. The client reported a history of "passing out" after receiving vaccines.

65 2021-03-18 fast heart rate Bells palsy effect; Rapid heartbeat; Numb nose, nasal cavity, cheeks; Numb eyelids; A spontaneous re... Read more
Close
Bells palsy effect; Rapid heartbeat; Numb nose, nasal cavity, cheeks; Numb eyelids; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, concerning a 65 year-old, female who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed a rapid heartbeat/tachycardia, her nose, nasal cavity, cheeks and eyelids were numb/hypoaesthesia, Bell's palsy effect/facial paralysis. The patient's medical history included were overweight and pre diabetic. The patient was allergic to latex and was dairy sensitive was not provided. Concomitant product included was vitamins. On 16 Feb2021, few minutes prior to the onset of symptoms, the patient received her first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (batch number: 004M20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 16 Feb 2021, the patient, while she was staying for 15 minutes in the facility, she felt a rapid heartbeat. It was not alarming, but it was faster than normal. Five minutes after leaving the facility, which was 20 minutes after she received the vaccine, her nose, nasal cavity, cheeks and eyelids were numb. This numbness stayed for two hours and the disappeared. The numb sensation on the nose stayed for 3 whole days after the vaccine was administered. The patient consulted the primary doctor, who stated that it was a Bells Palsy effect. Treatment information was not provided. The outcome of the events of rapid heartbeat, nose, nasal cavity, cheeks and eyelids were numb were considered recovered and the outcome for Bells palsy effect was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Flue like symptoms; Little off balance; Severe mid chest pain; Fatigue; Arrhythmia a couple of times; Tremors a couple of times; Itching all over the body; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 65-year-old, female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced itching all over the body/pruritus, fatigue, flue like symptoms/influenza like illness, little off balance/balance disorder, tremors and arrhythmia(intervention/medically important) a couple of times and severe mid chest pain/ chest pain. The patient's medical history as provided by the reporter included cochlear implant. Concomitant medications reported included domperidone. On 09 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013M20A) intramuscularly in the left deltoid for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 12 Feb 2021, the patient experienced itching all over the body. On an unspecified date, the patient experienced fatigue, flue like symptoms, little off balance, tremors and arrhythmia a couple of times and severe mid chest pain. Lab details were not provided by the reporter. Treatment for the events included ibuprofen. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events were not reported. The outcome of the events, itching all over the body, fatigue, flue like symptoms, little off balance, tremors and arrhythmia a couple of times and severe mid chest pain were unknown.; Reporter's Comments: events of unexpected influenza-like illness, chest pain, tremor, balance disorder, pruritus, and expected fatigue. Event onset occurred Day 4 after the first dose of mRNA-1273. Treatment with ibuprofen. Event outcomes unknown. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

65 2021-03-30 loss of consciousness passed out on the floor; heaving all day; really cold; headache; fever; chills; A spontaneous report... Read more
Close
passed out on the floor; heaving all day; really cold; headache; fever; chills; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 65-years-old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced passed out on the floor, really cold, heaving all day, headache, fever and chills. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 21 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the events the patient received first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot: 007M20A) intramuscularly in the left deltoid for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 21 Feb 2021, patient experienced sore arm and it recovered on 22 Feb 2021. On 18 Mar 2021, prior to the onset of the events the patient received second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch:032M20A) through unknown route of administration in the left deltoid muscle for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 18 Mar 2021, the patient experienced really cold, headache, fever and chills. On 19 Mar 2021, the patient experienced passed out on the floor and heaving all day. The event passed out was medically significant. No laboratory data was provided. No treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not applicable as it was second dose of vaccine. Th events really cold, fever and chills were recovered on 19 Mar 2021. On 19 Mar 2021 the outcome of cold, fever and chills. On 20 Mar 2021 the outcome of event(s), headache, passed out on the floor, heaving all day was resolved..; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 65 Y/O F with serious unexpected loss of consciousness and nonserious unexpected retching and nasopharyngitis, and expected pyrexia, chills, and headache. Event onset the same day as the second dose of mRNA-1273. Events resolved. Based on current available information and temporal association between use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
65 2021-03-31 fibrin d dimer increased About 3 days after the vaccine my daughter mentioned to me that I was not breathing right. It was ha... Read more
Close
About 3 days after the vaccine my daughter mentioned to me that I was not breathing right. It was harder to breathe and I could not even take a shower that I would be out of breath. My daughter checked my pulsox and it was 85. I couldn't really walk or do anything so my daughter transported me to ER and lots of labs were done so since my D Dimer was too high they did a CT scan and it showed some blood clots in my lungs. They admitted me because they were concerned with the location of one of them. They did some heart tests too and put me on Eloquis and then sent me home. I stayed for 2 days. Then they scheduled me FUs with a heart doctor and a pulmonologist.

Concomitant medications reported were cholesterol medicine (Lipitor), levothyroxine, calcium, vitamin D, multivitamin, magnesium for drug use for unknown indication. On 24-JAN-2021, prior to the onset of the events the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot/batch: 037K20A) intramuscularly in the right arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 04-FEB-2021, the patient experienced the blood pressure high without being hypertensive before. Blood pressure was 200/100; Very dizzy; Could not lie down without things spinning around; Felt unsteady; Nauseous; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 65-year-old, female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced blood pressure raise (200/100) with dizziness, nausea, vertigo and gait disturbance. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 27 Feb 2021, 16 hours prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number: 010A21A) intramuscularly for the prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 28 Feb 2021, the patient woke up to turn over and was very dizzy. The dizziness continue most of the following day, and the patient was also nauseous and could not lie down without things spinning around. The patient stayed upright and felt unsteady so they had to hold on to the walls to move around. The patient was taken to urgent care where her blood pressure was 200/100. She was taken to the hospital where she remained for two days and tests were taken. Treatment medications included nitroglycerin and acetylsalicylic acid. The patient was released from the hospital on 02 Mar 2021. She had an appointment with her PCP (primary care physician) on Friday 05 Mar 2021 for follow-up. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcomes of the events were reported as unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.

The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate and salmeterol xinafoate and salbutamol. On 27 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number: 025A21A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 28 Feb 2021, the patient had arm soreness and in night her legs felt achy. On 01 Mar 2021, the patient suddenly had light headedness, dizzy, and sweaty. The patient sat down on floor passed out for five minutes. The patient reported feeling better. Treatment for the events included Ibuprofen and paracetamol. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The outcome of the events, the patient sat down on floor passed out for five minutes was considered as resolved on 1 Mar 2021. 65 2021-04-05 low blood oxigenation Moderna COVID Vaccine EUA Pt received Dose 1 of Moderna vaccine 3/18/21. Developed symptoms 3/25/21... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID Vaccine EUA Pt received Dose 1 of Moderna vaccine 3/18/21. Developed symptoms 3/25/21. Presented to ED 3/28/21. 3/28/21: 65-year-old female with past medical history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus presented to ER with complaints of shortness of breath. Per patient she received her 1st COVID-19 vaccination last Thursday. Since Monday the patient has felt "unwell." Three days ago she started having shortness of breath which has progressively worsened, especially with exertion. She has developed increased fatigue, cough, nausea and decreased appetite. Denies chest pain. No vomiting or diarrhea. On arrival to ED patient she had a low-grade fever and was hypoxic at 87% on room air. Supplemental oxygen with 2 L NC with improvement in oxygenation saturation to 94%. Laboratory findings were significant for hypokalemia 3.0, transaminitis ALT 55, AST 44. COVID positive. Chest x-ray revealed bilateral airspace disease with obscured pulmonary vasculature. Favored to represent pneumonia over heart failure. EKG normal sinus rhythm, rate 74, QTC 472. Patient was given IV fluid resuscitation with NS 3 L bolus. Potassium 60 mEq p.o. given. IV Rocephin was initiated and DuoNeb treatment given in ER. 4/2/21: Pt received remdesivir, convalescent plasma, ceftriaxone, doxycycline, dexamethasone, vitamin C, zinc sulfate. Patient discharged on doxycycline course, PO zinc and vitamin C, supplemental oxygen. Instructed to follow up with PCP in 3-5 days.
65 2021-04-05 loss of consciousness She got her vaccine, and started out with the sore arm, but she was sitting in the bathroom sometime... Read more
Close
She got her vaccine, and started out with the sore arm, but she was sitting in the bathroom sometime after 11:00 preparing to do a peritoneal dialysis exchange and blacked out. She grabbed onto the towel bar on the wall and fell hitting her left hip, left ankle and left upper arm. She does not remember too much after that, but that she was in and out of consciousness until about 12:30 PM Saturday when she remembered being alert but nothing made any sense to her. Her son came in and found her on the floor, she could not get up, she had a skin tear on her right elbow and she had been incontinent of bowel and bladder. He started to ask her the orientation questions and got them all wrong, but she knew that she was confused and disoriented. She could not get up on her own, called the paramedics and they took her to the hospital. The confusion and disorientation lasted into early Sunday morning 3/28/2021 at about 3:00 AM when she started to answer questions appropriately. As the day went on things got better, but still exist to this point today 4/6/21. It was more severe as she came out of the confusion. She has brain fog, inability to sequence thoughts, a little bit of expressive aphasia. She had two CAT scans and an MRI that were negative for subdural or CVA's. I had urine specimen and blood cultures to rule out a UTI or sepsis and those were negative. Her kidney labs were normal. She ABG's drawn and those were normal. They placed her on oxygen and she sat for 3 days and then they released her to home. Today, she is still having the brain fog, still the not able to sequence thoughts, general fatigue. She is black and blue from shoulder to elbow due to the fall.

cardiac arrest; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of CARDIAC ARREST (cardiac arrest) in a 65-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 011A21A and 011A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The patient's past medical history included Heart attack in September 2020. Concomitant products included LEVOTHYROXINE, ATORVASTATIN, CLOPIDOGREL BISULFATE (PLAVIX), CARVEDILOL, ACETYLSALICYLIC ACID (ASPIRIN 81), VITAMIN D3, ALENDRONATE SODIUM (ALENDRONATE), LISINOPRIL and FAMOTIDINE for an unknown indication. On 25-Feb-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 25-Mar-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 27-Mar-2021, the patient experienced CARDIAC ARREST (cardiac arrest) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). The patient was hospitalized on 27-Mar-2021 due to CARDIAC ARREST. At the time of the report, CARDIAC ARREST (cardiac arrest) outcome was unknown. Cardiac catheterization to be performed on the patient on 31-MAR-2021. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the onset date of the reported event of cardiac arrest, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However, patient's recent myocardial infarction may have been contributory.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the onset date of the reported event of cardiac arrest, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Vaccine breakthrough hospitalization - SOB with O2 sat 50% when EMS arrived. On non-rebreather satting 70%. Chills, fever, cough, and chest pain. BP 152/79, HR 93, RR 20, SpO2 91%. Had been scheduled to receive COVID mAb day of admission, but clinical course worsened. Admitted to Medical ICU for acute respiratory failure with hypoxia and ARDS secondary to COVID-19. Placed on BIPAP and Rx with Remdesivir, dexamethasone, & tociluzumab. Treated for presumed pulmonary embolism with full-dose anticoagulation. Pt expressed wishes to remain DNR/DNI, ultimately she elected to transition to comfort measures only given worsening hypoxia.

65 2021-04-13 chest pain, pulmonary embolism Bilateral pulmonary embolisms requiring ICU admission. Patient presented to Emergency Room on 4/13/2... Read more
Close
Bilateral pulmonary embolisms requiring ICU admission. Patient presented to Emergency Room on 4/13/21 with presented to the ED with shortness of breath and chest pain. The patient notes that she developed shortness of breath, particularly with exertion, about 1 week prior to presentation. 2-3 days prior to presentation, she developed pleuritic chest pain on the right anterior chest. She denies any recent fevers, chills, weight changes, palpitations, cough, sputum production, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, lower extremity edema. She does note that she received her first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on 3/16/2021 and was due for dose#2 on the day of admission. She denies a personal history of blood clots and denies current smoking, estrogen use, or recent surgery. She does note a history of blood clots in her sister, but she is unsure whether they were provoked or unprovoked. Patient required BiPAP on admission and was initiated on a heparin drip. Initial CT w/ some concern for R heart strain, however, echocardiogram showed no signs of R heart strain and she was hemodynamically stable. She was weaned from the BiPAP to Non-rebreather, and eventually nasal cannula. The heparin drip was transitioned to lovenox with plans to go home on a DOAC. Still hospitalized at time of event report.

pain underneath her breast; chest hurt; bacterial pneumonia on left lower lobe; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of PNEUMONIA BACTERIAL (bacterial pneumonia on left lower lobe) in a 65-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 038A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The patient's past medical history included Diabetes, Asthma, Hypertension and High cholesterol. Family history included Heart disease, unspecified. On 11-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 05-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PNEUMONIA BACTERIAL (bacterial pneumonia on left lower lobe) (seriousness criterion medically significant). At the time of the report, PNEUMONIA BACTERIAL (bacterial pneumonia on left lower lobe) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 05-Apr-2021, Computerised tomogram: abnormal (abnormal) Pneumonia on left lower lobe.. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No concomitant medications reported. Treatment of the events included doxycycline. She had a CAT scan on 05Apr2021 because she had been having pain underneath her breast and her chest hurt. She had to cancel her second dose scheduled for 08Apr2021 due to the pneumonia. She had not been able to find appointment for her second dose and was concerned she may not be able to get the second dose. Company Comment: This case refers to a 65-year old female patient with relevant history of Diabetes, Asthma, Hypertension and High cholesterol who experienced Pneumonia bacterial, chest pain, and breast pain following the administration of Covid-19 vaccine and was assessed as Unlikely Related to study drug due to lack of temporal relationship. The subject's underlying disease history can be strong confounding factors. The pneumonia bacterial can be caused by bacterial infection and the immunocompromised system can allow the patient to higher risk for infections.; Sender's Comments: This case refers to a 65-year old female patient with relevant history of Diabetes, Asthma, Hypertension and High cholesterol who experienced Pneumonia bacterial, chest pain, and breast pain following the administration of Covid-19 vaccine and was assessed as Unlikely Related to study drug due to lack of temporal relationship. The subject's underlying disease history can be strong confounding factors. The pneumonia bacterial can be caused by bacterial infection and the immunocompromised system can allow the patient to higher risk for infections.
65 2021-04-17 palpitations, chest pain, hypertension All of a sudden started to feel lots of pain in my chest; Heart was really raising; Blood pressure f... Read more
Close
All of a sudden started to feel lots of pain in my chest; Heart was really raising; Blood pressure felt high; Rash all over my neck and chest; This spontaneous case was reported by a patient (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of CHEST PAIN (All of a sudden started to feel lots of pain in my chest), PALPITATIONS (Heart was really raising) and HYPERTENSION (Blood pressure felt high) in a 65-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 047A21A and 014M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No medical history reported). On 27-Feb-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 27-Mar-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 28-Mar-2021, the patient experienced CHEST PAIN (All of a sudden started to feel lots of pain in my chest) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), PALPITATIONS (Heart was really raising) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and HYPERTENSION (Blood pressure felt high) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On 29-Mar-2021, the patient experienced RASH (Rash all over my neck and chest). The patient was hospitalized from 28-Mar-2021 to 29-Mar-2021 due to CHEST PAIN, HYPERTENSION and PALPITATIONS. On 29-Mar-2021, CHEST PAIN (All of a sudden started to feel lots of pain in my chest), PALPITATIONS (Heart was really raising) and HYPERTENSION (Blood pressure felt high) had resolved. At the time of the report, RASH (Rash all over my neck and chest) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 28-Mar-2021, Catheterisation cardiac: unknown (Inconclusive) unknown. On 28-Mar-2021, Echocardiogram: unknown (Inconclusive) unknown. On 28-Mar-2021, Ultrasound scan: unknown (Inconclusive) unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Treatment medication included nitroglycerin given twice. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not applicable. On next day after second dose, while watching movie the patient had all of a sudden started to have lots of pain on her chest (never had this before), then her heart was really raising, and blood pressure felt high. This lasted for about seven hours. Patient went to hospital because patient thought was having a heart attack. Patient was given nitroglycerin which helped within a few minutes. Then they gave her another nitroglycerin and pain went down and was feeling no more pain. However, subject was admitted to the hospital and they did lots of test with one of them was a cardiac catherization, also echocardiogram and sonogram. Patient indicated her heart was fine, no heart attack, never experienced anything like that, and that next day, she had a rash all over my neck and chest. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested This case was linked to MOD-2021-073606 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested

65 2021-04-20 loss of consciousness Passed out and broke foot; broke foot; lightheaded; Massive headache and couldn't lift her head up; ... Read more
Close
Passed out and broke foot; broke foot; lightheaded; Massive headache and couldn't lift her head up; Not feel good; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out and broke foot) in a 65-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (batch nos. 025B21A and 036A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No medical history reported). On 08-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 05-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 05-Apr-2021, the patient experienced FEELING ABNORMAL (Not feel good). On 06-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out and broke foot) (seriousness criteria medically significant), FOOT FRACTURE (broke foot), DIZZINESS (lightheaded) and HEADACHE (Massive headache and couldn't lift her head up). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out and broke foot), FOOT FRACTURE (broke foot), DIZZINESS (lightheaded) and HEADACHE (Massive headache and couldn't lift her head up) had not resolved and FEELING ABNORMAL (Not feel good) outcome was unknown. Not Provided For mRNA-1273 (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Concomitant medication included medication for thyroid. Treatment information included for an events Advil and Aleve. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

65 2021-05-04 loss of consciousness passed out; can't walk very well without assistance; Sleepy; Very weak; headache; In appropriate dos... Read more
Close
passed out; can't walk very well without assistance; Sleepy; Very weak; headache; In appropriate doses interval, more than 35 days; This spontaneous case was reported by a non-health professional (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out) in a 65-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 013M20A and 013M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Asthma (Taking asthma medication as concomitant). On 04-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 19-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 19-Apr-2021, after starting mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine), the patient experienced INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (In appropriate doses interval, more than 35 days). On 20-Apr-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), GAIT DISTURBANCE (can't walk very well without assistance), SOMNOLENCE (Sleepy), ASTHENIA (Very weak) and HEADACHE (headache). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out), GAIT DISTURBANCE (can't walk very well without assistance), SOMNOLENCE (Sleepy), ASTHENIA (Very weak) and HEADACHE (headache) outcome was unknown and INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (In appropriate doses interval, more than 35 days) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 23-Apr-2021, Computerised tomogram: (Negative) negative. On 23-Apr-2021, X-ray: (Negative) negative. No treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not applicable. The patient's heart was checked but no abnormal results. Company comment: This report refers to a case of Inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered for mRNA-1273, lot # 013M20A with associated AEs(loss of consciousness, gait disturbance, somnolence, asthenia and headache). Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: This report refers to a case of Inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered for mRNA-1273, lot # 013M20A with associated AEs(loss of consciousness, gait disturbance, somnolence, asthenia and headache). Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Elevated blood pressure and heart rate. 163/116 HR 125. I got up at 9:00 am with elevated BP and HR. I had missed a dose of Metoprolol the previous evening. I felt shaky/jittery and checked my BP and HR. Called the doctor on call at my PCP's office and he stated it is probably rebound hypertension and elevated HR due to missing the dose of Metoprolol last night. His direction was to check in two hours, and if still elevated, take 1/2 tablet Metoprolol. Current readings at 2:00 pm are 129/97 HR 99. Unsure if related to Covid vaccine. MD recommended reporting to CDC

Were severe for about an hour and then started subsiding. Gradually felt better over the course of a couple of hours. After about 6 hours, symptoms completely gone and I felt fine.

66 2021-01-06 palpitations While waiting 15 minutes after the injection, I begin to feel my heart bounding. I checked my heart ... Read more
Close
While waiting 15 minutes after the injection, I begin to feel my heart bounding. I checked my heart rate on my Apple watch, it was 165. The heart rate slowly came down to the 120's after approximately 30 seconds and remained their for thirty minutes. I felt better and left the vaccination location. Shortly after, while driving home my heartrate went up to 152 for approximately the same amount of time so I drove to my doctors office and explained what happen. They told me to go to the emergency room. By then my heartrate was 109 and I was feeling better. I did not feel the need to go to the emergency room, which I live less than a mile from the nearest hospital. Eventually my heartrate settled at 70-80's nearly 4 hours after the event.

Initially started as shortness of breath followed by fevers, aches, muscle cramps. Ultimately ended up in the hospital with hypoxemia, pleural effusions. 66 2021-01-16 heart rate increased While driving home after leaving facility 15 minutes after shot, I started having an increased heart... Read more
Close
While driving home after leaving facility 15 minutes after shot, I started having an increased heart rate. Once home, the rapid heart rate continued and I noticed throat swallowing was getting a little tighter. I started drinking water and just breathed normally sitting down. I went to a mirror to see if I could see any swelling of my face and noticed my neck right under my chin was red about half way down. My chest seemed fine. I continued to just sit & drink water and soon the heart rate was getting back to normal. I noticed the redness on my neck was getting lighter also. I looked at my watch and it had been a little over an hour since my vaccination. I did not seek treatment, nor have I called my doctor. There have been no more adverse reactions.

66 2021-01-25 loss of consciousness, loss of consciousness Patient states worst of side effects started about 11:20pm that night. Patient went to bed after get... Read more
Close
Patient states worst of side effects started about 11:20pm that night. Patient went to bed after getting home about 8pm. Patient had pain that started in arm where she got shot, then hurt in right leg, and then left leg and arm. Patient passed out at one point, causing her to fall and hit head on bathroom floor. She did not seek any medical attention at that time and has not since her vaccine. She had extreme thirst from 8pm until 3am. She could not sleep due to pain. Patient was foggy after that for several days, but she is back at work today and feels much better. Patient doesn't think she had fever. She did have a lot of hot/cold flashes. Patient states she is entering information into the VAERS online system herself since she knows all her symptoms. Patient is wanting to speak to someone that knows about Mold toxicity and if it correlates to the covid Vaccine. She states she had the same symptoms when she had mold toxicity before. States she had a mold toxin dump at that time when she lived in Dallas and was given an IV which caused symptoms to stop. Patient states she will look up someone if she needs to and does not want the provider to do any leg work. She has several books and has ordered more. When this occurred before, she had hyperbaric oxygen therapy and believes this pushed toxins out of her cells into her body

Close
Heart started racing about 7:00 pm the night of the vaccine until today (I haven't noticed it today for the first time since the vaccine). The next morning after - so nauseous; and aching all over; so tired I could hardly move as I had joint pain, too. Couldn't throw up but nausea was there constantly - even when I went back to work on Monday I as still nauseated and still in pain. When I came home from work on Monday the body aches were gone and my leg felt numb. So it lasted a good four days for me. No treatment except drank lots of liquids and stayed still as I could so nausea wouldn't worsen. I still ache but that might be because of my ruptured disc.

7:00 PM onset of chills and fairly severe body aches - concentrated in lower back and hips. Went to bed early - slept to 8:00 PM. Woke up so got up to take evening meds and brush teeth. Had vertigo and moderate nausea. While brushing teeth, I fainted. Came around quickly - was on bathroom floor. Took only one of my medications - the one to prevent migraines and went back to bed. Continued with body aches and chills on and off through the night. In the morning I had worsened vertigo and nausea, but this is typical of my vestibular migraines and I think that was what was going on. I called in sick to work, took one of my pills for treating migraines and basically slept all day. I do not get migraines often - usually

Resident received 2nd Covid 19 vaccine from Moderna on 1/26 in Rt deltoid. Immediately felt a little lightheaded during the 15 min window afterward but was able to ambulate independently with walker just afterward. After taking a nap, she woke with a headache, chills, a little shaky and feeling very tired. She was able to eat and take Tylenol at the time. For the rest of the day, she felt under the weather. The next morning she was very weak, unable to ambulate and tachycardic prompting nursing staff to send her to the hospital for assessment.

Next morning, day 6, a rash began on my chest and spread throughout the day, until it covered my entire torso and both arms. I took benadryl that night and by day 7, the rash began to subside leaving me very itchy for another day.

I checked it on my finger pulse oximeter. It lasted about a minute I coughed and bear down and heart rate went back down. The next day I didn?t feel well, red rash about an inch or two below injection site, headache, tired, arm sore and temperature of 99.8.

Close
Had delayed itching about 30 hours after first dose but brief and minor. Had slight minor itching within 15 minutes of second dose but brief and minor, taking benadryl before injection and twice after. Then 3 days later (injection on Fri 5:00 pm) reaction Monday 3:00 pm) noticed hives on both hands and some small spots on arm and itching. Over next 2 hours noticed injection site had large irregular rash-y area. Was in another county getting first aid and cpr training ironically, even going over how to use an epi-pen. Could not take benadryl as had to drive 45 min home. Started driving home and began feeling very bad with chest tightness, more itching, decided better to go to ER half-way to home as I live out in the county. At triage bp was 180/111 and had tachycardia, I think they said 145 bpm. They did EKG labs etc. Dr. diagnosed allergic reaction and tachycardia. Administered oral and IV meds and IV fluids and was discharged and home by 8:15 pm. feel fine the next day, but taking steroid and antihistamine prescription level medications to control. Meds given at hospital listed: zyrtec tablet 10 mg Pepcid 20 mg Benadryl 50 mg Solu-Medrol 125 mg NS -0.9 1000ml Lopressor 5 mg Home medications Hydroxyzine HCL 25 mg 1 tab every 6 hrs prn Prednisone 20 mg 1 tablet 2x daily 5 days

Close
Patient is a 66 y.o. female presents with increasing shortness of breath and fatigue the last few days. The patient presented to the ER just a few days after being discharged from Hospital. The patient was treated as an inpatient at Hospital little under a week ago for a COPD exacerbation. She showed dramatic improvement during this time, but over the last few days has started showing increasing signs of shortness of breath and severe fatigue. She has no known coronavirus (COVID-19) contact, but states that anything is possible. Her rapid coronavirus (COVID-19) test in the ER was negative. However, her chest CT seem to suggest a severe viral pneumonia. Because of this, the patient is going to be admitted to the hospital as she has failed outpatient therapy and is significantly hypoxic.

Became very unsteady on feet, requiring support of walls, furnishings and counters. 66 2021-02-18 loss of consciousness, fainting My mother came home after receiving the Moderna vaccine shot and did not feel well. She had confusio... Read more
Close
My mother came home after receiving the Moderna vaccine shot and did not feel well. She had confusion, pain in her left arm near the injection site. She attempted to relax for a while and then became very nauseous, faint, and vomited. She claimed she tried to lay down in her bed and then attempted to get up to vomit and could not physically move. On Tuesday, I found her at 2:30 PM unconscious in her bed. Vomit/blood all over the floor by the bed side, her face was very warm, her breathing was very short. I could not get her to respond to me through feel or communication so I called 911. She was taken to the ER by ambulance at this time. She was taken the hospital where she was placed on IVs (I think one for antibiotic and the other was a steroid). Hospital performed blood work, CT scan, chest x-ray, and lumbar tap. They did not find any issues with my mother other than she had an "elevated white blood counter". Lumbar tap did not yield any signs of infection or foreign bacteria. She was discharged on Wednesday (02/10/2021) evening and went home to rest. She has been very fatigue since her return home and reported to me today (02/19/2021) that she had symptoms of being faint, cold sweats, and overall weakness. I checked her blood pressure and temperature and did not see a concern.
66 2021-02-21 hypertension After receiving the Moderna COVID 19 vaccine the pt. (while walking around in the store with her hus... Read more
Close
After receiving the Moderna COVID 19 vaccine the pt. (while walking around in the store with her husband) began to feel dizzy and weak. She came back to the pharmacy area and she was seated and had her blood pressure checked. It was high (194/84) but she reported that she does have high blood pressure and takes her med at night. She was given a bottle of water, monitored and her blood pressure was checked twice again over the next 20 minutes. It read lower each time she was checked and when it read 156/84 she said she felt fine and was ready to leave with her husband. She also said she was diabetic and had eaten a small breakfast compared to normally. She will be contacted today to make sure she is still feeling ok.

66 2021-02-25 blood glucose increased A little more than 5 hours after vaccination, patient experienced symptomatic hypoglycemia with a Bl... Read more
Close
A little more than 5 hours after vaccination, patient experienced symptomatic hypoglycemia with a Blood Sugar reading of 48 after eating 1/2 candy bar and drinking gatorade. She took a nap (knowing that what she had just consumed would increase her blood sugar) and woke up feeling better. She ate dinner, and her blood sugar afterwards was elevated at 397. She noted that this drop in blood sugar following the vaccine happened with the first dose as well, though she never reported it (symptomatic hypoglycemia with a blood sugar reading of 46).

66 2021-02-25 oxygen saturation decreased, hypertension Patient said she wasn't feeling well about 10 minutes after receiving her vaccine. She felt dizzy, ... Read more
Close
Patient said she wasn't feeling well about 10 minutes after receiving her vaccine. She felt dizzy, thought she was going to faint. We gave her ice for the back of her neck. We checked her blood pressure, it was 230/130, pulse was within normal limits. Pulse ox was low. An ambulance was called. She removed her mask and stepped back so that she could breath better and her oxygen and coloring improved. She said that her lips felt numb, so we gave her some benadryl just in case. We did not give an epi pen due to her increased blood pressure. Her blood pressure did start improving but was still high when the ambulance came. They took her to the ER for evaluation and she will be following up with her pcp also. The hospital felt that it was just a fainting episode.

The day following the vaccine I was fine until approximately 1:30 p.m. when I suddenly got very, very dizzy, had disequilibrium and began to feel nauseous, and had diarrhea. The dizziness increased from mild to so bad I had to hold onto the wall to walk to the bathroom. I took half a Benadryl but it continued to escalate and I took another half a Benadryl at which time it stopped escalating but did not dissipate until approximately 4:45 p.m. I called my physician who was unavailable so I just depended on the Benadryl. There were no breathing difficulties but I had a scratchy throat in the middle of the attack and my tongue went numb and tingly.

Close
Passed out; Felt lightheaded; Upset stomach; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 66 year old female patients who received Moderna's Covid 19 vaccine(mRNA1273) experienced loss of consciousness, dizziness and abdominal discomfort. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant product use was not provided/unknown by the reporter. The patient received first of two planned dose of mRNA-1273 for prophylaxis of Covid 19 infection on 14-FEB-2021 intramuscularly in left arm. Patients felt lightheaded and fell unconscious at evening of vaccine administration. EMS was called ,but patient regained consciousness by the time EMS arrived. Patient also experienced abdominal discomfort on the day she got vaccinated. Treatment information was not provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event(s) was not provided/unknown. The outcome of the event were considered as recovered/resolved.

66 2021-03-01 heart rate increased An estimation of about five minutes after receiving the Covid19 (Moderna) vaccine, my heartrate incr... Read more
Close
An estimation of about five minutes after receiving the Covid19 (Moderna) vaccine, my heartrate increased to around 100 beats a minute (as told to me by Dr. ). My breathing felt a little different but it could have been from wearing two masks for a longer period of time than usual. After ten or fifteen minutes, I felt sort of dizzness and it didn't feel quite normal around my eyes and forehead. The staff were extremely attentive to me. I probably was there after the shot for 30-45 minutes. Dr. suggested my symptoms was due to anxiety and out of an abundance of caution, the emergency squad was called and I was taken to Hospital Emergency Department.

66 2021-03-01 pallor, palpitations She received first dose of Moderna vaccination on 1/5/2021 into left deltoid. It was painless. Appro... Read more
Close
She received first dose of Moderna vaccination on 1/5/2021 into left deltoid. It was painless. Approximately half an hour after injection, she began to feel tingling in the left arm, hand, and fingers. It resolved on its own and she was fatigued that evening and went to bed early. The next day she had soreness of the arm, fatigue coming through the day in waves. On 1/7, low grade fever of 99.1, headache, and fatigue. She slept for 14 hours. From 1/8-11 she had no significant issues although she did feel slightly off balance. On 1/12, she noticed left axillae lymphadenopathy and had soreness at the injection site again, which worsened the next day. On 1/14, arm was red, swollen, and tender to touch. These symptoms persisted the next day and she began to have numbness and pins and needles of the left hand. She was given 7 days of dexamethadone and cephalexin by her PCP. She slept very poorly. The next day, the numbness, swelling, and redness were all improved. On 1/17, she continued to gradually improve and there was no swelling and only slight numbness. She did have fatigue, headaches, and insomnia. On 1/21, she had visit with an allergist to discuss preventative measure for second dose. A delayed reaction was theorized and a preventative course of premedications was outlined. The next day, the numbness in the hand worsened and headache returned. On 1/23, she felt headache, confsuoin, anger, imbalance, pins and needles in the hand, difficulty holding a glass with one hand. On 1/24 pain at the injection site recurred. She felt there was change in her vision and hearing, nausea, vibration throughout the body, mouth numbness, and heart racing. On 1/25 all these symptoms persisted other than improvement in confusion. On 1/26-27, she had continued pins and needles in hands and feet. Still felt vision and hearing were "off". She was fatigued and body felt "like jello". On 1/28, she was prescribed a second course of dexamethasone as well as citalopram 20mg and diazepam. With citalopram, she had nausea, hot/cold sensations, dizziness, insomnia. She also had itching of the arm, back, leg; tremor, thirst, and pallaor. She reported symptoms to PCP and citalopram was discontinued next day. On 1/30-31 she felt disoriented at times, intermittent arm soreness, noted small abnormal bruising, hot/cold, off balance, headache, and fatigue. Since that time, predominant symptoms have been daily headache. Wakes with left posterior dull aching which escalates through the day 5/10 but will become 8/10 if she does not take anything. She is taking ASA in AM daily with second dose around 3PM when headache recurs approximately 5x/week. Sensation in feet has normalized, but she continues to have numbness in left>right hand. She feels off balance with need to specifically concentrate when walking. No falls. She also has persistent abnormal tremor of left finger. When she goes to type, she will press key 3-4 times. She feels difficulty opening water bottles, but is able to do some. She is lifting pans with both hands.

frequent numerous loose stools, gas, bloating, myalgia and arthralgia, swollen lymph nodes in neck, headache, chest pain
66 2021-03-02 blood clot Anxious; Tired; Blood clots in left leg, right leg and brain; A spontaneous report was received from... Read more
Close
Anxious; Tired; Blood clots in left leg, right leg and brain; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer who was also a 66-year-old female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed blood clots in the left leg, right leg, and brain, anxious and tired. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant medications reported included vitamin D, magnesium, lisinopril, and vitamin B12. On 14 Jan 2021, approximately 3 days prior to the onset of symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number not provided) intramuscularly in the left deltoid for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 16 Jan 2021, the patient experienced immense pain in the middle of the night, and subsequently saw her primary physician. An ultrasound revealed blood clots in her left leg, right leg and brain. A hematologist and vascular surgeon were consulted. Patient was treated with apixaban while they are doing blood work. The patient also became tired and anxious. She noted that she never had comorbidities before and was upset that her life has completely changed. A repeat ultrasound was scheduled for 19 Feb 2021. The mRNA-1273 dose was discontinued in response to the event of blood clots in the left leg, right leg, and brain, anxious and tiered. The outcome of events, blood clots in the left leg, right leg, and brain was considered unknown at the time of this report. The outcome of the events, tired and anxious were considered not resolved at the time of this report.; Reporter's Comments: Very limited information regarding the events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
66 2021-03-02 palpitations Fatigue, nasal congestion and headache immediately after vaccination on 2/26/21 and that night fast ... Read more
Close
Fatigue, nasal congestion and headache immediately after vaccination on 2/26/21 and that night fast heart rate, burning lymph nodes on right side, burning tissue around right hip prosthesis, burning right eye and tongue, severe pain in right glute muscles and lower spine, back of neck felt still and slightly swollen, lightheaded and felt cold. Symptoms continued the following day. By 2/28/21 burning symptoms and fast heart rate ceased, still had dull headache, congestion and fatigue, plus pain in lower back and right hip. On 3/02/21 noticed hard lump, like a boil, near right hip prosthetis scar, felt cold, tired and dizzy all day. On 3/03/21 another hard lump, like a boil, on left neck.
66 2021-03-02 chest discomfort Pressure between shoulder blades. It went away then started again on carotid then down arm; Sore arm... Read more
Close
Pressure between shoulder blades. It went away then started again on carotid then down arm; Sore arm; hot feeling initially; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, who was a 66-year-old, female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine and who experienced a serious adverse event of chest discomfort requiring hospitalization (reported as: "heart attack like symptoms, pressure between shoulder blades that went away and then started again on her carotid then down her arm" and in addition non-serious events of sore arm, and hot feeling. The patient's medical history included borderline type 2 diabetes and allergies to adhesive tape, bleach and chlorine. Concomitant product use was not provided. The patient received her first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (LOT 012M20A) on 05-Feb-2021 intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. Initially on 05-Feb-2021, patient experienced a sore arm that was warm to the touch. However, on 15-Feb-2021, she reported having had heart attack-like symptoms. She stated that it started as pressure between shoulder blades that initially went away and then started again on her carotid and travelled down her arm. She thought it was from loading wood. The patient then went to Emergency Room (ER) where she received a nitro pill which alleviated the pain. The EKG, cardiac enzyme tests, nuclear imaging and stress test were all negative according to the patient's report. She reported having been hospitalized for 2 days. Treatment for the event included a nitroglycerin tablet. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The outcome of the events, sore arm, hot feeling initially, heart attack like symptoms, pressure between shoulder blades that went away and then started again on her carotid then down her arm, was not reported.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship for events cannot be excluded.

66 2021-03-03 chest pain Chest pain; Joint aches; Body aches; Fever; Chills; Fatigue; Nausea; A spontaneous report was receiv... Read more
Close
Chest pain; Joint aches; Body aches; Fever; Chills; Fatigue; Nausea; A spontaneous report was received from a 66 year old, female patient who was participating in the mRNA-1273 Emergency Use Program and experienced chest pain, body and joint aches, fever, chills, fatigue, and nausea. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. The patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 on 10-Jan-2021. On 11-Feb-2021, approximately 2 days prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly for the prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 11-Feb-2021, the patient developed body and joint aches, chest pains, fever, chills, fatigue, nausea, and just hurt all over and felt terrible. On 12-Feb-2021, the patient's symptoms persisted, and she was in the emergency room (ER) to be treated. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the events, therefore action taken with the drug in response to the events is not applicable. The outcome of the events, chest pain, body and joint aches, fever, chills, fatigue, and nausea, was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

66 2021-03-03 loss of consciousness Patient had completed her 15 minute observation when she stood up to place her coat on. She stepped ... Read more
Close
Patient had completed her 15 minute observation when she stood up to place her coat on. She stepped to the side of her chair began to sway, her feet shuffled, her knees buckled and she feel to her bottom and then back on her head. When I and the EMT arrived to her she seemed to be out. She came to quickly and was taking to us. She then was alert oriented to person and place. She knew the date but could not state the year. She also could state the month and date of her birth but not her birth year. When asked what happened She stated she go lightheaded and fell. She couldn't remember the incident. She remembered standing felling lightheaded and then she remembers being on the ground with myself and the EMT talking to her. Took HR and BP. We got her to a sitting position on the floor when she was ready. Took HR and BP. Then we stood and sat her in a chair. Took HR and BP and obtained a Glucose. Called her sister to come to the vaccine center. Talk to patient about going to the ED. The ED doctor who was communicating with EMT requested patient goes to the ED. Patient initially was refusing. Patient went to the restroom with assist of her walker and nurse. She was still a little unsteady. Patient did agree to go to ED. Sister arrived and we filled her in on the events. Ambulance arrived and we sent patient to the ED

Close
An hour after the injection I began to feel light headed, off-balance and somewhat nauseous. In the next half hour, I went to lie down on the floor of my office because the room was spinning and I was extremely nauseous. A doctor in the building checked my vitals and ordered an ambulance to take me to the hospital. The EMTs checked my vital and my blood pressure was quite high. They started fluids and added Zophran for nausea while in the office. In the emergency room , again my vitals were checked and the Zophran was beginning to calm down the nausea. I slept for an hour (or two) and the spinning had stopped. I was discharged around 5:15pm.

66 2021-03-11 oxygen saturation decreased, blood pressure decreased She got the vaccine, and within 2 minutes she felt nauseous. Then she stayed there for 30 minutes, ... Read more
Close
She got the vaccine, and within 2 minutes she felt nauseous. Then she stayed there for 30 minutes, and after she left about 2 hours later had a headache. Then about 3 hours after that she had chills and her normal temperature which is 97.3, it went up to 99. Then after that probably 4-5 hours later her BP dropped down to 70/50 which her normal high range is 90 Her heart rate was going from 38 to 103. Her oxygen level went down to 88, which normal is 91, this was around midnight. She was sleeping off and on, lethargic all day long. Got up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and her whole body inside was shaking and afraid that she was going to fall down, and fell back to sleep. The next day when she woke up still had the headache, still felt nauseous, but the other symptoms subsided. About 30 hours later she started feeling much better, with the headache and all symptoms subsiding around 5:00 PM the following evening. All her VS returned to their normal range. She called her doctor and after they called her back on Monday and advised her not to take the 2nd vaccine, her PCP. Her Cardiologist who suggested that she wait 90 days for the 2nd one.

66 2021-03-15 heart rate increased, body temperature decreased Hello, FYI: My first Moderna vaccination I had a sore arm and fatigue for a day. For my second Mode... Read more
Close
Hello, FYI: My first Moderna vaccination I had a sore arm and fatigue for a day. For my second Moderna vaccination it was at 0745 6 Mar 2021. Twelve hours later side effects began. The first night was brutal. Temperature rapidly rose to 102. Joint aches, fatigue but couldn't sleep due to the pain, loss of taste and smell, nausea, felt real cold, shakes, congestion, gassy, hurt to breath, headache, shallow breathing, slightly elevated heart rate. I drank a lot of water and hot Green Tea. I did call the medical center and spoke with a nurse about whether it was Covid or side effects to the second vaccination. Second day was miserable; I still had a fever that gradually went down. Finally was able to sleep end of second day. I continued to drink a lot of water and hot Green Tea. Third day, still fatigued, mild heachach. Mild sore arm for three days. Third through nine days I have a below normal temperature, hoarseness, mild headache, and fatigue. the medical center gave me annual flu vaccinations. I've never had a side effect from them. While I was in the medical center, before I was deployed overseas, the medical center gave me some dozen vaccinations. Again, no side effects from them. I have never been around anyone who turned out later to have Covid 19 or tested positive for it. I have never had the flu. I have had some four cases of a cold. Worst illness was after my exposure to norovirus. I was gravely ill, had to be admitted to the hospital here. Norovirus worse than the two cases of food poisoning I had. I figure with those awful side effects I now have an immune system better able to handle Covid 19 if I do get exposed. Per CDC, I will still wear a mask, social distance, avoid medium- and large-sized crowds, avoid poorly ventilated public and private spaces, and wash my hands frequently for the forseeable future.

Pt received her 1st Moderna covid vaccine at Clinic on 3/11/21. She noted a history of bee stings and that she has an epi pen at home so was given the shot and monitored for 30 minutes. 20 minutes post vaccine, patient noted she felt dizzy and somewhat disoriented. She noted a dry throat and like her arms and legs felt funny "like jello". Her husband alerted staff at the vaccination site and EMS assessed her. She said she was told her blood pressure was high for her but otherwise vitals were fine. She denied itching, or shortness of breath or trouble breathing. She actually asked her husband to go home and get her epi pen and he returned with it and was given a dose of epi and sent to the local emergency room for evaluation. She said she felt better by the time she got their but was monitored for a number of hours. She felt completely fine by the time she was discharged. She noted for a few days following the vaccine she felt fatigued and a slightly itchy spot at injection site but that's it.

Heart flattering fast; Her resting heart race is 54-56, but that morning was higher; Sore arm; This spontaneous report was received from a consumer (patient) and concerns a 66 year old female patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced arm was sore, felt the heart flattering fast. Her resting heart race was 54-56, but that morning was higher. The patient was very active, exercised every day and ate very healthy. Patient was a very healthy person and has no medical conditions, only was allergic to Sulfas. On 09 Feb 2021, the patient received her first dose of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 016M20A) solution for injection intramuscularly in her left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 10-Feb-2021, patient felt the heart flattering fast. This sensation lasted 2 minutes. The doctor stated that this could be a heart attack and because it happened after receiving the Covid-19 vaccine, this could be a possible side effect. On 10 Feb 2021, the patient resting heart race was (54-56s), but in the morning it was higher. On an unknown date the patient had laboratory test AKG. Seriousness Criteria for the events of heart flattering fast was medically significant. Action taken with suspect drug mRNA-1273 was unknown; Reporter's Comments: Being sent back to CP

Close
2/1/2021, on the 6th day from the time of the vaccination, at approximately 7:00 I began having a severe headache and my heart rate was on and off irregular. I could only sleep partial sitting to keep heart in regular. 2/2/2021: Next morning, okay but tired, but went to work. work at desk with computer. That evening, I began having severe breakouts like hives -hot, burning, itching, swelling. Started under the breast with a large red circle and then on lower stomach, lower back. Next day, 2/3/2021. breakout under breast still evident red and painful; breakout moved to other parts of body now breakouts are on inside of thigh and lower leg. Continue with Benadryl. Helps with itching but does not stop the breakouts. 2/4/2021: - Continue with breakouts. Some get better, go away but some continue. That night began swelling in roof of mouth, hot and painful and right side of throat (inside). Went to Emergency room Doctor said continue with Benadryl and see primary doctor. 2/5/2021: - Breakouts continue but changes somewhat. Now affecting joints. Hot, red, swelling, itching palm of hands, some finger joints and back of hands. Bottom of feet & sides, and ankles. Side of knees, elbows. Continue with Benadryl. Helps some with anti-itch cream. 2/6/2021 + - Continue with breakouts. Rash on arm where vaccine shot was administered. Breakout Rash and swelling under arm both arms and other parts of body. 2/16/2021? Appoint with Cardiologist, Dr. Begin medication for irregular heart rate. Metoprolol Tartrate 25 mg. 1 x day. Continue with breakouts. 3/4/2021: Appoint with allergy specialist, Dr., Allergy. She prescribed Cetirizine 10 mg 2 x day, Famotidine 20 mg 2 x day. Begin medications. Very helpful swelling went down in hands and feet. Breakouts stopped. 3/6/2021: Breakouts start again but very small areas; 3/9/2021? hot itching, knotty areas on buttocks, inside of knee. As of 3/19/2021 (date of this report) Continue to have painful breakouts in various places? Intense varies. Return to allergy specialist 4/1/2021 for appointment.

while taking blood pressure patient passed out; not feel well; fever; aches; headache; chills; A spontaneous report was received from a nurse concerning a 66-year old, female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced fever, aches, headache, chills, did not feel well and passed out. The patient's medical history included atrial fibrillation following symptoms of feeling sick, headache and chest discomfort in September 2020. Current conditions included elevated blood pressure (BP) and a shrimp/shellfish allergy. Concomitant medications included apixaban, carvedilol, lisinopril and vitamin D. On 04 Feb 2021, the patient received the first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch Number: 013M20A) intramuscularly in left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 05 Feb 2021, one day after receiving the vaccine, the patient experienced fever, aches, headache and chills. She took paracetamol and felt better. On that same day at approximately 1330, 24 hours after the vaccine, the patient was preparing a sandwich and was not feeling well. She sat in a chair to take her blood pressure and passed out. At some point, it was reported that patient was admitted to the hospital for a five-day stay. (admission/discharge dates not reported). Treatment for the events included paracetamol. There was not change planned to the dosing schedule of mRNA-1273 in response to the events as it is known that on 05 Mar 2021, the patient received the second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch Number: 002A21A) intramuscularly in left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. The outcome of the events, fever, aches, headache, chills, not feel well and passed out, was considered recovered/resolved on an unspecified date.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
